title: Ralph Hasenhuttl blames himself after Southampton fall to 9-0 loss against Leicester City
text:
Southampton manager Ralph Hasenhuttl has accepted full responsibility for his side's humiliating 9-0 defeat at home to Leicester.

Ayoze Perez and Jamie Vardy scored hat-tricks, while Ben Chilwell, Youri Tielemans and James Maddison also scored as Leicester recorded the biggest away victory in English top flight history.

Hasenhuttl will face further uncertainty over his future at Southampton after the defeat, but was eager to praise the club's supporters.

Southampton manager Ralph Hasenhuttl accepted responsibility for his side's heavy defeat

He said: 'I must apologise for this performance, I take 100 per cent responsibility for what happened today.

'I want to say that I am proud of the fans, they stayed in the stadium until the end of the game, it was not easy to watch for anybody who follows us and for everybody who is a Southampton fan today.

'They did well to stay until the end and stay with us. We have to apologise for what happened today and stand up again.'

Hasenhuttl admitted that the early dismissal of Ryan Bertrand, when Southampton were 1-0 down, played a key part in proceedings, but also lamented the many defensive errors that his side made.

Hasenhuttl criticised Southampton's woeful defending as they lost 9-0 against Leicester

He said: 'It is not the moment to go into details now… after the red card every attack was a goal nearly.

'No defending at all… when you act like this don’t be surprised about conceding 9 goals.'

Asked if his players didn't try, Hasenhuttl replied: 'You can call it giving up if you want can call it helpless or whatever you want the result is for everything perfect. You can combine everything with the result. It was a disaster.'

The 52-year-old admitted that he hadn't previously experienced a game such as this during his coaching career.

Hasenhuttl said: 'You can call it giving up if you want can call it helpless or whatever you want the result is for everything perfect. You can combine everything with the result. It was a disaster.'

Rather worryingly for Southampton, their next two fixtures are away to Manchester City, in the Carabao Cup and Premier League respectively.
description: Southampton manager Ralph Hasenhuttl has accepted full responsibility for his side's humiliating 9-0 defeat at home to Leicester.
